sentences.en: a player from the opposing side
He went on record as opposing racial discrimination.
sentences.cn: 他公开表示反对种族歧视.

sentences.en: He's been opposing me all along the line.
I have a friend who has the opposing view and felt that the war was immoral.
sentences.cn: 我有一位朋友的看法截然不同，他认为这场战争是不道德的。

sentences.en: The economic crisis was interpreted in diametrically opposing ways.
sentences.cn: 对于这场经济危机有着截然不同的解释。

sentences.en: The mayor went on record as opposing a tax raise.
sentences.cn: 市长公开表示反对增税.

sentences.en: The opposing armies were preparing for war.
sentences.cn: 敌对双方的军队都在备战。

sentences.en: The opposing candidates sailed into each other.
sentences.cn: 竞选对手互相猛烈攻击.

sentences.en: The Socialist Party has split into two opposing camps.
sentences.cn: 社会党分裂成了两个对立的阵营。

sentences.en: The soldiers battled against the opposing army all day.
sentences.cn: 战士们与敌人整整打了一天.

sentences.en: The team's efforts to score were frustrated by the opposing goalkeeper.
sentences.cn: 该队想要进球的努力被对方的守门员挫败了.

sentences.en: The two opposing armies are locked in battle.
The two opposing armies faced each other across the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 敌对两军在战场上严阵对峙。

sentences.en: They challenge us with opposing views.
They warred against the opposing army 8 years.
sentences.cn: 他们与敌人整整打了八年仗.

sentences.en: We can learn much by being brought into contact with opposing opinions.
sentences.cn: 通过接触反面意见,我们可以学到很多东西.
我们和对方(球)队打成平局.

words.tran_cn: 反向地；在相反的位置；面对面
反对；反对派；在野党；敌对
反对（oppose的过去分词）；使对立

trans.tran_cn: 反作用的，反向的，相反的，对立的
trans.tran_en: opposing teams, groups, or forces are competing, arguing, or fighting against each other
